thread.section_title: Sports and Weather Right Now - Pro
thread.title: Seahawks Suspend Derrick Coleman Indefinitely After Arrest
thread.title_full: Seahawks Suspend Derrick Coleman Indefinitely After Arrest

author: Scott Malone
title: Seahawks Suspend Derrick Coleman Indefinitely After Arrest
text:
Seahawks Suspend Derrick Coleman Indefinitely After Arrest Posted: Seahawks fullback Derrick Coleman is under investigation of vehicular assault and hit and run. This is a picture of the aftermath of the crash Wednesday night. (Photo: Bellevue Police Dept.) SWXRightNow.com - 
The Seattle Seahawks have suspended fullback Derrick Coleman indefinitely pending further information about his arrest Wednesday night. He is under investigation of vehicular assault and felony hit-and-run, but a statement released by his agents Thursday says they believe he fell asleep while driving. 
At their news conference Thursday afternoon, Bellevue police confirmed that Coleman was arrested after a two-vehicle hit-and-run crash Wednesday night. 
The early results of their investigation are that a pickup truck was heading east at high speed just before 7 p.m. when it crashed into the back of a car ahead of it. 
The car was hit with such force that it rolled up a hill and landed on its top. The pickup also rolled over in the street. 
Police say witnesses pulled the driver of the pickup out of the truck, and then he fled the crash scene on foot without checking on the other driver. Officers say that other driver was seriously hurt, but does not have life-threatening injuries. 
Police found Coleman nearby and he was arrested without incident for leaving the scene. Officers performed a field sobriety test on Coleman, but there’s no indication that he was drunk or high. So far, the results from that sobriety test are not available. 
Coleman was booked into the King County Jail early Thursday morning, and he was held without bail. 
Coleman's agents, Derrick Fox and Mark Bloom, released a statement to reporters that reads: 
“On the evening of October 15, 2015, Seattle Seahawk Fullback Derrick Coleman, Jr. was involved in a two-car collision soon after leaving a team meeting. While the facts of the case are still being determined, it seems Derrick may have fallen asleep while driving home from a Seahawks’ facility. The health and well-being of all involved is our primary concern, and we are thankful to report that both parties are expected to make a full recovery. We will continue to work closely with the local officials while a full investigation is being conducted." The Seattle Seahawks have suspended Derrick Coleman indefinitely pending further information. — Seattle Seahawks (@Seahawks) October 15, 2015 
Coleman is in his fourth season with the Seahawks. He spent the 2012 season on the practice squad before making the 53-man roster in 2013. Coleman missed 11 games and the playoffs last season because of a broken foot. The 24-year-old is one of two fullbacks currently on the roster along with Will Tukuafu. He has one yard on two carries so far this season. 
Coleman is legally deaf and his football success has made him an inspirational figure. He has been featured in TV commercials and written a book that was released this year. 
He played for UCLA and then was part of the Minnesota Vikings' practice squad before signing with Seattle in December of 2012. 
Information from the Associated Press was used in this story. More >> Strange Late Sequence Gives Seattle 13-10 Win Over Detroit Kam Chancellor made a great defensive play that was overshadowed by a controversial one. (Photo: NBC on SNF) SEATTLE (AP) -- Kam Chancellor saw the ball exposed and threw a punch. By knocking the ball free from Calvin Johnson, Chancellor may have created a wild swing in where the Seattle Seahawks will finish this season and provided another bit of officiating controversy on a Monday night in Seattle. "It's good to have Kam back. To have him make that play was pretty cool," Seattle quarterback Russell Wilson said. Chancellor punched the ball free as Johnson was about to score... More >> Lynch, Mebane Downgraded to 'Out' for Monday Night Game vs. Lions Marshawn Lynch has been downgraded to 'out' for the Seahawks Monday night game. SEATTLE (AP) - The Seattle Seahawks have downgraded running back Marshawn Lynch and defensive tackle Brandon Mebane to out for Monday night's game against the Detroit Lions. Seattle announced the changes in status following the team's walkthrough practice on Sunday. Lynch and Mebane had both been listed as questionable after Saturday's final practice. More >> SEATTLE (AP) - The Seattle Seahawks have downgraded running back Marshawn Lynch and defensive tackle Brandon Mebane to out for Monday night's game against the Detroit Lions. Seattle announced the changes in status following the team's walkthrough practice on Sunday. Lynch and Mebane had both been listed as questionable after Saturday's final practice. More >> Lockett Return Ignites Seattle As Seahawks Pick Up First Win, 26-0 Over Chicago SEATTLE (AP) -- One burst of speed from rookie Tyler Lockett ignited Russell Wilson, Jimmy Graham and the rest of the Seattle Seahawks after a sleepy start against Chicago. Lockett returned the second-half kickoff 105 yards for a touchdown, Wilson and Graham connected on a 30-yard TD in the third quarter, and the Seahawks routed the undermanned Bears 26-0 on Sunday. Seattle led just 6-0 at halftime after an offensive performance that led to a cascade of boos.
